item.title: Best Horror Games Where Surviving Is Exhausting
item.description:
Summary

  • The exhaustion in horror games comes from surviving against monsters & psychological terrors, not just physical combat.
  • Games like The Forest & Soma can leave players physically & mentally tired after intense survival challenges.
  • Horror games like Resident Evil 7 & Outlast make players feel drained by constantly facing life-threatening situations.

Horror games can be some of the most stressful to play, especially those that put the player into intense moments of survival. While these games are great for some players, even the best horror games can be quite exhausting to experience. Being exhausted isn't always a bad thing, especially when playing a horror game, as these exhausting moments put the player directly into the shoes of the protagonist as they fight for their life.

This exhaustion when surviving can either come from a player having to defend themselves against various monsters or other foes, as well as horror games being just as exhausting when a player is forced to survive while also having no way to defend themselves. These are the best horror games where surviving is exhausting, ranked by how exhausted a player is likely to be after experiencing the terrors.

The Forest

Being Stuck In The Wilderness Is Tiring

The Forest
9.1 /10
Released
April 30, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Intense Violence, Blood and Gore, Partial Nudity
Developer(s)
Endnight Games
Platform(s)
PC, PS4
Powered by

Starting off strong, it's no surprise that survival horrors can be some of the most exhausting, though great, horror games to survive within. Players are likely to be exhausted from the start when trying their luck with The Forest , as players are crash-landed on an island and expected to create shelter for themselves quickly.

Players don't just have to worry about finding the resources needed to keep themselves alive, but also make sure they are well-protected enough to fight off against the foes that stand behind their wooden walls. In The Forest , players will not only encounter cannibals that will keep returning every night, but also, eventually, mutants that will really test the player's limits before it's time to take a break.

Soma

Psychological Terrors That Tire The Mind

SOMA
8 /10
9.8 /10
Released
September 15, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
t
Developer(s)
Frictional Games
Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox One, PC
Powered by

Soma is another horror game that players will likely find themselves feeling exhausted while playing. Although a survival horror like The Forest , the exhaustion from playing this title doesn't come from fighting off various foes, but instead the psychological toll it takes on the player.

Those who are familiar with the game Amnesia will be somewhat prepared for the horrors ahead when playing Soma , which was created by the same developers. As players delve deep under the water in this sci-fi horror, they will unlock some horrible truths while being on edge at every interaction, tiring the mind of the player.

Barotrauma

Spend Countless Hours In A Submarine

Barotrauma
8.0 /10
Released
March 13, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
t
Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

Players usually get exhausted when playing solo. However, games like Barotrauma can not only exhaust one player, but also all their friends. In this survival horror game set within a submarine in a sci-fi world, players must work together to keep their ship from exploding while navigating horrific underwater tunnel systems and the monsters that can be found within them.

Even when a team of players thinks they have full control, that doesn't stop the stresses that come along with this entertaining title. Every part of the ship must be maintained and controlled. When danger hits, the team is likely to go into a panic, which can leave many players tired afterward. Depending on the role a player has in Barotrauma , they feel that more rely on them, making the hours of exploration much more exhausting.

Darkwood

Both Day And Night Are A Horror To Explore

6 Images
6 Images
Darkwood
7 /10
9.0 /10
Released
August 18, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
m
Developer(s)
Acid Wizard Studio
Platform(s)
Xbox One, PS4, PC, Switch
Powered by

There is never a moment of peace in Darkwood as players will always find themselves on the edge of their seats while playing. Every night in Darkwood , the player must make sure their lights stay on inside and the windows are barricaded to prevent the creatures that can be found in the forests from getting into the player's house. Hiding in a corner with a gun aimed at the doorway is the only way to make sure the player doesn't end up dead.

After such an exhausting night, the player doesn't even get a break during the mornings of Darkwood as they are forced to explore the horrific overgrown forest and the buildings within to find the resources they need to survive. Playing Darkwood for long periods of time is likely to tire a player both physically and mentally, making this horror game, although perfect, one that a player should take plenty of breaks with.

Resident Evil 7: Biohazard

Plenty Of Intense Moments Around The House

Resident Evil 7: Biohazard
13
8.9 /10
Released
January 24, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Developer(s)
Capcom
Platform(s)
PS5, PS4, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One, Switch, Stadia, PC
Powered by

The Resident Evil franchise has been one of the best horror franchises to be released, with many players adoring almost every title available, including those such as Resident Evil 7: Biohazard , where Capcom attempted to bring the world of Resident Evil into the first-person. With this all-new point of view, players could feel far more immersed in the world of Resident Evil 7 , as they fight for their lives against the Baker family and the other horrors around the house.

Resident Evil had been scary in the past, but Resident Evil 7: Biohazard brought a whole new sort of intense fear. Any moment, the father of the house could crash through a wall and refuse to die no matter how many bullets the player wasted, not to mention the other strange happenings around the house. Players could even play this title in VR for those who want to be even more exhausted.

Silent Hill 2

Feel Only Despair As The Player Digs Deeper

Silent Hill 2
9 /10
70
9.1 /10
Released
October 8, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ // Blood and Gore, Language, Sexual Themes, Violence
Developer(s)
Bloober Team
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, PC
Powered by

Although many of the greatest but exhausting horror games tend to tire players due to intense survival moments, some games, such as Silent Hill 2 , instead exhaust players as they fall deeper into the despair of the themes covered in such a touching yet frightening game.

Silent Hill 2 returned to the eyes of players in 2024 after the classic title was remade. With an entirely new look to it, players can experience the trauma of those stuck within Silent Hill all over again. This horror title still has combat elements to it that can be quite intense at moments, but the real exhaustion comes from exploring the dead, silent town of Silent Hill.

Alien: Isolation

Avoid Being Hunted By Aliens And More

Alien: Isolation
6 /10
27
9.6 /10
Released
October 7, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Strong Language, Violence
Developer(s)
Creative Assembly
Platform(s)
PS4, PS3, Xbox One, Xbox 360, Switch, PC, Android, iOS
Powered by

One of the most common ways a horror game makes surviving exhausting is through the persistent threat of danger. In Alien: Isolation , players are constantly being hunted by a Xenomorph that uses its senses to track down the player no matter where they are hiding. The alien isn't stupid and pays attention to how the player tries to avoid it, or the hiding places they favor the most to catch an unexpected player.

As players navigate the space station in Alien: Isolation , the player should always be cautious about the noise they make or where they look, become a moment of life or death. Although players do have ways to defend themselves, some moments are better avoided, keeping the player's energy up.

Outlast

Players Only Have A Camera To Record Horrors

Outlast
8.0 /10
Released
November 4, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
Mature // Intense Violence, Blood and Gore, Sexual Content, Nudity, Strong Language
Developer(s)
Red Barrels
Platform(s)
PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch, PC, Linux, macOS
Powered by

By far, out of all the incredible horror games created over the years, the game that is still one of the most exhausting to survive in is Outlast . Trapped within an Asylum looking into a story, Outlast doesn't hold back from scaring its players. As the start of a popular and successful franchise, Outlast, even though it tires its players through all sorts of stress, continues to pull players back to its horrifying scenarios.

Outlast is another horror survival experience where the player has no way to defend themselves. This leaves the main character with only their camera on hand to record the experiences they encounter while running for their lives to avoid the monstrous people inside, such as Chris Walker, who could easily break the player in half.

item.title: Monopoly GO: What happens If you Don't Open Your Vault Before the Next Album?
item.description:
Monopoly GO ’s Vaults in the Stickers for Rewards section are a major part of the game’s sticker economy. By turning duplicate stickers into Sticker Stars , players can unlock tiered vaults that offer some of the best rewards in the game, including dice rolls, cash, and premium sticker packs. As one sticker album ends and a new one begins, though, many players wonder: what happens if you don’t open your Vault before the next album kicks off in Monopoly GO ?

What Happens If You Don't Open Your Vault Before the Next Album?

When you collect duplicate stickers, they automatically convert into Sticker Stars. These stars can then be spent to unlock one of three vaults in the Sticker for Rewards menu in Monopoly GO . Vaults can be opened once per day, giving players steady rewards.

If you don’t open your Vault before the current album ends, the game automatically converts your Sticker Stars into dice rolls . For example, if you’ve saved up at least 700 Stars, you’ll receive about 750 dice rolls. However, any Stars beyond the conversion cap are permanently lost forever.

When a new sticker album launches in Monopoly GO , every player starts fresh. All sticker sets are reset, and any unused Stars in the Stickers for Rewards section are cleared out. This means Stars do not carry over to the next album, so it’s best to spend them while you still can.

To get the most out of the dice conversion, try to save up 700 Stars before the new album begins. You can get more stars by collecting dupes of stickers or requesting your Monopoly GO friends to send you some.

Can You Carry Over Your Vault Rewards to the New Album?

The short answer is simple: No, you can not carry over your vault rewards to the new album. Your vaults do not carry over once a new sticker album begins, and you’ll also lose out on the sticker packs tied to the vault. When the season resets, all unopened vaults and unclaimed rewards are cleared. The only thing that survives is the dice compensation, which is helpful but not as valuable as the vault’s full rewards.

This means the only guaranteed way to benefit from your vault rewards is to open them before the season ends . If you don’t, your Sticker Stars will still be converted into dice, but the vault-exclusive rewards like premium sticker packs will be lost with the reset.

item.title: PS Plus Monthly Games for September 2025 Wish List
item.description:
PlayStation Plus has had a strong summer so far. With the service celebrating its 15th anniversary near the end of June, Sony has since been offering members a greater number of deals, specials, and bonus giveaways across all tiers. The last few batches of PlayStation Plus Essential games have also been perceived as relatively more welcome compared to those that arrived in the early half of the year, with some highlights including Diablo 4 and Lies of P . Now that August is drawing to a close and September's announcements are on the horizon, it's time to turn to considering the next PS Plus potential choices.

PS Plus September 2025 Wish List: Resident Evil 4 Remake

Read Game Rant's Review of Resident Evil 4 Remake

Resident Evil 2 and Resident Evil 3: Nemesis were announced to be hitting PS Plus back in June, and the pair have now joined the Premium tier. Both are certifiable survival horror classics, but even beyond them, RE4 is arguably the series' most famous and well-liked title. The 2023 remake was equally, if not more, lauded for how it retained the core experience while containing modern polishes and updates. Resident Evil 4 Remake has been oft-requested for PS+ and with Resident Evil Requiem releasing early next year, now would be the perfect time for it to be added.

PS Plus September 2025 Wish List: Stellar Blade

Read Game Rant's Review of Stellar Blade

Debuting in 2024 as a close partnership project between developer Shift Up and Sony, and a PS5 exclusive at the time, Stellar Blade 's Soulslike action gameplay and post-apocalyptic story made it a breakout hit. Stellar Blade has seen a number of updates since, and bringing it to PS Plus in September would give any players who missed it the opportunity to check its high-quality experience out.

PS Plus September 2025 Wish List: MLB The Show 25

Read Game Rant's Review of MLB The Show 25

San Diego Studio's MLB The Show is published by Sony, and the franchise previously had a major presence as a longtime PS exclusive. The latest entry received an update in June, and with the current season now in full swing ahead of the World Series in October, the service adding the popular baseball sim this month would be great timing for it to take the field again and let fans loose on the digital diamond.

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

September 2025 Wish List For PS Plus Extra and Premium

While the above three would be promising choices for Essential, there are, as always, a couple of other popular and/or interesting games that would work well to round out the upper tiers' catalog:

  • Solar Ash - The Journey -inspired Sword of the Sea is one of August's PS Extra titles. Heart Machine's Solar Ash would be an excellent double feature for September, as it also sees fans surfing through a series of gorgeously rendered and mysterious landscapes.
  • The Order: 1886 - Though it had a somewhat controversial launch ten years ago when it was intended to be a showcase for the then-next-gen PS4, The Order: 1886 represents an ambitious part of the console's history. Its third-person gameplay, unique setting, and well-crafted story make it a solid Extra or Premium pick.
  • Until Then - An indie game taking inspiration from the culture of the Philippines, Until Then is a light-hearted, narrative-based game on the surface, with many moments of charming humor. But it also explores mature themes of loss while adding in some soft sci-fi elements, and features wonderfully crisp pixel art.
  • Octopath Traveler - Square Enix recently announced Octopath Traveler 0 , and the original title on PS+ would be a great introduction or refresher for players ahead of the new entry.
  • Dungeons of Hinterberg - Another creative indie title, this hybrid of a Zelda-like adventure and social sim uses both to highly satisfying effect. On vacation in a semi-magical scenic tourist town nestled away in the Austrian Alps, protagonist Luisa must explore and conquer various themed dungeons while managing her relationships with the locals and fellow visitors.

As summer starts to come to a close, there's still time left to bask in its glow, and PlayStation Plus bringing any of the above titles to the service in September would go a long way towards letting players do just that.

item.title: Dice Dreams: Free Rolls For August 2025
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Dice Dreams Links For August 2025
  • How To Redeem Dice Links In Dice Dreams

From attacking opponents and collecting resources to upgrading your kingdom, Dice Dreams is a great option for everyone who enjoys board games with a competitive twist. As the name implies, the core mechanic of Dice Dreams revolves around rolling dice to determine movement and actions on the board.

If you feel like your dice supply is running low, you can use dice links to get free rolls in Dice Dreams . With these free rolls, you can continue rolling the dice to build your kingdom, collect resources, and compete with other players to become the true Dice King.

Updated August 24, 2025, by Usama Ali: Dice Dreams turns every roll into an adventure, letting you collect coins, raid other kingdoms, and build your own dream empire. However, once your dice run out, the fun can come to a stop. That’s where free Dice Dreams links come in. These limited-time rewards give players bonus dice, coins, and other helpful items to keep the momentum going. Since the links often expire quickly, it’s important to claim them as soon as possible to avoid missing out. To make things easier, we’ve compiled all the latest working links in one place and keep the list updated regularly.

We added four new links today.

Dice Dreams Links For August 2025

Like most board games, the developers of Dice Dreams regularly introduce dice links for players running low on dice. These links can be helpful in continuing your progress and can be used to redeem various rewards, including rolls and Building Blitz, which can consequently help you build your kingdom. Moreover, these links occasionally reward millions of coins, but most of the time, you'll receive rolls. Below is a list of active links that Dice Dreams players can use to earn some free goodies.

These links are only active for a limited time period, so make sure to redeem them before they expire.

In addition to redeeming rewards from these links, you can earn rolls in Dice Dreams through various other methods. These include regularly participating in events, inviting friends to the game, and taking advantage of in-game promotions and offers. While spending real money is not recommended, you can invite new players or link your Facebook account to get rolls for free.

Expired Dice Dream Links

Like most mobile games, Dice Dreams links expire quickly, usually within a day or so. Recently, there’s been a noticeable shift in the frequency of these link releases, and developers have reduced their quantity. As such, it’s uncertain how long the links will remain active moving forward. For your convenience, here are some expired Dice Dreams links:

How To Redeem Dice Links In Dice Dreams

To redeem a link in Dice Dreams for its reward, you'll first have to click on the links mentioned above. These links will redirect you to another page where you'll see "Get." Click on that, and you'll be redirected to your game, where you'll receive the respective rewards instantly.

You need to have the Dice Dreams app installed before clicking on the link, or else the links and "Get" button will not work.

Make sure to only click on dice links from trustworthy sources to avoid malware or data leakage issues. The links included here have been tried and tested to ensure players don't run into any problems.

item.title: High on Life 2 is Coming With 5 Extra Games That Are Fully Playable
item.description:
Upcoming Squanch Games sequel High on Life 2 will offer players multiple games to find in-game, and yes, they are fully playable. The list of games to find and play in High on Life 2 includes the infamous Bible Adventures .

Those who played the original High on Life will remember the four movies players could watch in their entirety. The game licensed movies like Tammy and the T-Rex , Blood Harvest , and Demon Wind, allowing players to sit and watch them from the comfort of a theater in High on Life . It was a series of cool Easter eggs, and it seems that the sequel is set to take things a step further.

High on Life 2 Will Let Fans Play More Than Five Emulated Games In-Game

Speaking to IGN at Gamescom 2025, Squanch Games chief creative officer and art director Mikey Spano revealed that the game will include "some surprising B+ tier movies," while also featuring emulated, playable video games from years past. According to Spano, there are "more than five," one of which is the 1991 game Bible Adventures , which has often been touted as one of the worst video games of all time. "Yes, you can play the whole thing," Spano said. "And it's not the only emulated game in there."

Spano didn't reveal any more of the games to IGN, nor the number of games that players will be able to play upon High on Life 2 's release. Still, it's a fascinating and innovative way to preserve these older titles legally. If Bible Adventures is any indication, players are definitely in for an interesting time when it comes to the emulated games in High on Life 2 .

High on Life 2 launches on February 13, 2026, on PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X/S. The original High on Life was extremely popular on Xbox Game Pass upon its launch almost three years ago, and the sequel aims to repeat the feat at the start of next year. The first game received a Top Critic Average of 69 on review aggregator site OpenCritic, and the hope is that the sequel can take several steps forward to improve on this score considerably.
